Pat Williams

Draft Rating:

B-

Pat Williams ranks in the 61th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Williams's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 2 spots higher than they were picked due to his good drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Charles Barkley with 5th pick but was worth 3th pick.
  • Drafted Maurice Cheeks with 36th pick but was worth 2th pick.
  • Drafted Nick Anderson with 11th pick but was worth 4th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Darryl Dawkins with 5th pick but was worth 31th pick.
  • Drafted Terry Catledge with 21th pick but was worth 60th pick.
  • Drafted Stanley Roberts with 23th pick but was worth 38th pick.

Trade Rating:

C

Pat Williams ranks in the 50th percentile for trading among executives in our database. That's basically average. It could be worse though lol.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Julius Erving to PHI.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Roy Hinson to PHI.
  • Lost Brad Daugherty to CLE.

Signing Rating:

D+

Pat Williams ranks in the 34th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Darrell Armstrong in 1995.
  • Signed Horace Grant in 1994.
  • Signed George McGinnis in 1975.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Jeff Turner in 1989.
  • Signed Greg Kite in 1990.
  • Signed Brian Shaw in 1994.
